cs.helsinki.fi.desu

Class BitOperation

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs.helsinki.fi.desu.BitOperation

  • public class BitOperation
extends java.lang.Object
    Does all operations on bytes and bits, for example XOR and getting needed bits from a byte.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BitOperation()

      Concatenates a byte vector from two given bytes and a number of bits two extract from each.

      Takes a vector and extracts one bit from given position.
      byte[] extractMultipleBits(byte[] input, int pos, int n)
      Takes a vector of bytes and extracts bits from it from starting position to end position.

      Rotates bits to the left from given input vector by given number of positions.

      Separates blocks to chunks of required size.
      void setBit(byte[] input, int pos, int value)
      Inserts a bit value to a byte vector.

        public void setBit(byte[] input,
          int pos,
          int value)
        Inserts a bit value to a byte vector. Calculates which nit needs to be set and to which value.
        Parameters:
        input - input vector
        pos - place to insert value
        value - value to set bit in pos to

      • extractBit

        public int extractBit(byte[] input,
             int pos)
        Takes a vector and extracts one bit from given position.
        Parameters:
        input - byte to extract bit from
        pos - where to extract bit from
        Returns:
        the bit from pos

      • extractMultipleBits

        public byte[] extractMultipleBits(byte[] input,
                         int pos,
                         int n)
        Takes a vector of bytes and extracts bits from it from starting position to end position.
        Parameters:
        input - vector of bytes
        pos - starting position
        n - number of bits to extract
        Returns:
        extracted vector of bytes

      • rotateLeft

        public byte[] rotateLeft(byte[] input,
                int len,
                int steps)
        Rotates bits to the left from given input vector by given number of positions. Variable len allows for a single byte from a byte array to be rotated.
        Parameters:
        input - input byte vector
        len - length of bits to rotate
        steps - number of times to rotate
        Returns:
        new byte vector with bits rotated

      • xor

        public byte[] xor(byte[] a,
         byte[] b)
        Apply XOR to two sets of bytes and return the resulting byte[].
        Parameters:
        a - first vector
        b - second vector
        Returns:
        result vector from XOR-operation

      • separateBytes

        public byte[] separateBytes(byte[] input,
                   int len)
        Separates blocks to chunks of required size.
        Parameters:
        input - input vector of bytes
        len - length of block to get
        Returns:
        vector of bits of given length

      • concatBits

        public byte[] concatBits(byte[] a,
                int lenA,
                byte[] b,
                int lenB)
        Concatenates a byte vector from two given bytes and a number of bits two extract from each.
        Parameters:
        a - first byte
        lenA - length of bits to extract from a
        b - second byte
        lenB - length of bits to extract from b
        Returns:
        resulting byte
